Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Understand the Goal The objective is to analyze an event log containing 5 cases process instances against a provided normative process description I need to identify deviations violations and explain why they are violations based on the text

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyze the Normative Process Description Start Always begins with Receive order Second Step Check inventory must happen after Receive order and before payment authorization or fulfillment decisions Path A Sufficient Inventory Sequence Receive Check Authorize Payment Package items Ship order Close order Constraint 1 Authorize payment after Check inventory and before Package items Constraint 2 Package items after authorization and before Ship order Constraint 3 Ship order after Package items Constraint 4 Close order is the final activity Path B Insufficient Inventory Sequence Receive Check Cancel order Close order Constraint 1 After Check inventory if insufficient go to Cancel order Constraint 2 After Cancel order do not do fulfillment activities Package Ship Constraint 3 Close order follows Cancel order General Constraints Close order must be the last activity in all scenarios Shipping after cancellation is a violation Authorizing payment before checking inventory is a violation Packaging before authorization is a violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyze Each Case Case 1 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close Comparison Matches Path A exactly Verdict Compliant

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Sequence Receive Check Package Authorize Ship Close Comparison Receive Check OK Check Package Violation Text says Package items should only occur after authorization Package Authorize Violation Text says Authorize payment before packaging Authorize Ship main issue is Authorize Package swap Close OK Verdict Violation Package before Authorize

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Cancel Ship Close Comparison Receive Check OK Check Authorize OK for Path A but then Authorize Cancel Mixed signals Usually Cancel implies insufficient inventory If sufficient Authorize why Cancel text says if insufficient Cancel if sufficient Authorize Doing both weird but hard constraints Cancel Ship Major Violation Text says Once an order is canceled illogical to continue with fulfillment such as shipping Close OK Verdict Violation Ship after Cancel

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Sequence Receive Check Cancel Close Comparison Matches Path B exactly Verdict Compliant

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Ship Close Comparison Receive Check OK Check Authorize OK Authorize Ship Violation Text says Package items should only occur after authorization and before shipping Only after items have been properly packaged is it appropriate to proceed with Ship order Close OK Verdict Violation Missing Package items before Ship order

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Synthesize the Findings Violating Cases 2 3 5 Compliant Cases 1 4

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Draft the Explanations Case 2 The text states Authorize payment should only occur after Check inventory and before packaging and Package items should only occur after authorization Case 2 packages before authorizing Case 3 The text states Once an order is canceled it would be illogical to continue with activities intended for fulfillment such as packaging or shipping Case 3 ships after canceling Also the flow is ambiguous Authorize then Cancel but the Ship after Cancel is the definitive violation Case 5 The text states Only after items have been properly packaged is it appropriate to proceed with Ship order Case 5 skips packaging entirely between Authorization and Shipping

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Refine the Output Structure the response clearly Introduction Case by Case Analysis Summary Ensure the tone is analytical and references the prompts specific wording Address the ambiguities note in the prompt where relevant in Case 3 the mix of Authorize and Cancel is odd but the Ship after Cancel is the clear rule break

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Final Review against Constraints Did I identify which cases Yes 2 3 5 Did I explain why Yes Did I reference the text Yes Did I handle ambiguities Yes Self Correction during drafting In Case 3 is Authorize then Cancel a violation The text says if sufficient Authorize if insufficient Cancel Doing both suggests change or error However prompt flags shipping after cancellation focus on clearest violations Ship after Cancel hard violation Authorize before Cancel logically inconsistent but prioritize Re reading text If inventory sufficient Authorize If insufficient Cancel mutually exclusive Case 3 Check Authorize Cancel implies status changed odd but Ship after Cancel strongest Case 5 missing Package violation Text Only after packaged Ship Yes Case 2 Package before Authorize clear

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final Polish Check formatting and clarity Proceed to generate output one more check on Case 3 Text says Once canceled next reasonable step Close Case 3 Cancel Ship Close violates expectation no fulfillment one more check on Case 5 Text describes sequence Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close Case 5 skips Package violates Only after packaged appropriate to Ship Okay ready to write
